intro: Haemadictyon pallidum, commonly known as the pale false nettle, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Onagraceae. It is characterized by its delicate, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its stems are slender and can be somewhat hairy, and it typically grows in moist, open habitats. Haemadictyon pallidum is often found in wet meadows and along stream banks, where it thrives in damp, nutrient-rich soils.
